release.action: JMX URLs or part of them can optionally be encrypted with a private key. This enables clients to ensure that this JMX URL belongs to the expected owner by using its public key.
Changed interfaces for management of directory intervals.
JARMemory must close streams after reading jar file to unlock file.
New getter and setter to manage inheritance of log level between node, agent and bean.
SSL functionality for management interface.
New expose tags and action description attributes for semantic annotation of actions.
Directory provides interface to search for semantic service descriptions by using the semantic service matcher.
Added method to management interface to get and set the execution interval of agents and agent beans.
Use attribute userData of JMX notifications to make structured information about content of exchanged messages and parameters/results of performed actions available in jConsole.
Removed action state STARTED in ActionPerformedNotification due to similarity to state INVOKED.
Removed string representation of doAction in ActionPerformedNotification of management interface due to Java memory problems.
Logging framework changed from CommonsLogging to Log4j.
"Changed property for AgentBean execution interval. Name changed from executeInterval to executionInterval - old methods are stil present but deprecated."
"Improved performance of containsResource in the JarMemory class - this should improve classloading for agents that are installed from jars."
"Upgrade log4j dependency from version 1.2.8 to 1.2.17 to be compliant with log4j used by org.eclipse.xtext version 0.7.2."
"Creation of JMX connector servers can be configured for specific network interfaces."
"Added timeout for MulticastSocket in JMXManagementClient."
"Changed serialization of Session.java to accomodate for time differences of machines - Serialization is incompatible with older versions"
Creation of JMX connector server for each network interface and sending multicast message with the JMX service URL via this network interface.
Added method to management interface to get name of agent node's platform.
RMI connector tries to use global instead of local addresses to be available by remote JMX clients.
JMX management client provides a method to get the agent node ID for a given JMX URL.
Changed configuration of JMX connectors to be usable within AAMM.
The JMX names of all managed JIAC resources contains the unique ID instead the name of the corresponding agent node.
New module agentCoreAPI which contains all operational and management interfaces from agentCore.
